title: Has Riot games BANNED your account unjustly? Is your account worth a lot $$$. You have options.
body:
If you're a paying customer, and feel the services provided by Riot Games have not lived up to what was advertised - feel free to follow one of these links below to lodge a formal complaint. This includes their shady practice of banning expensive accounts to make you purchase additional ones. 

If you never take any action how can you ever expect them to change. 

Start with the California Attorney General's Office. Then also file a report with the Attorney General of the State you live in. 

https://oag.ca.gov/contact/consumer-complaint-against-business-or-company 

Next, file a complaint with the BBB. Below is the link.

http://www.bbb.org/losangelessiliconvalley/business-reviews/video-games-dealers/riot-games-in-los-angeles-ca-1013443/file-a-complaint

Lastly, make a formal complaint with the Department of Consumer affairs. Also included the link below for your reference. 

http://www.dca.ca.gov/

If everyone started to take action over Riot's Questionable practices, we would be heading in the right direction. Good luck to all my fellow League players that have been unjustly banned for financial gain. 

If you need a sample letter, I have also included that for you below to make changes as you fit. 

Hello my name is XXXX XXXXX and the video game League of Legends by Riot Games is my hobby. What I enjoy most about the game is the entertainment and funny interactions that it gives me with my fellow gamer's. I have been playing this game now for over a year and a half without any incident. One day when I was normally playing the game and chatting with my fellow gamer’s, all of a sudden my account was suddenly suspended for no reason and I was kicked out of the game. When I wrote about my account having been suspended, I was really surprised and taken back by the quality of customer service I received about my concerns. Since my initial contact with Riot Games, things have become abusive and my valued account has started to get suspended much more frequently. After having been first notified of my suspension, I took numerous steps to sensor myself. I started by keeping cross chat communication with the opposing team off. This meant that I would be unable to read or write messages to the opposing five member team and vice versa. Further action on my part had been to also mute 90 percent of my games. Having taken such extreme steps to censor myself, I was floored to find out that my account had been suspended again recently by Riot Games for no reason.  My reason for filing this complaint today is to bring attention to what Riot is doing to me and to prevent this from happening to my fellow gamer's.  I have received over 500 positive praises on my account from other gamer's. This contradicts any reason why they would suspend my account for 14 days. I find this type of practice unacceptable to high paying valued customers of the game. Thank you so kindly for listening to my concerns and I hope that we have a resolution not only for me but for future gamer's.


A service is meant to be enjoyed and it is not for us to be restricted and controlled by the people that own it for financial gain. What Riot Games does is they go after established players accounts that are worth a lot of money to them by finding excuses to label the players negative and to then ultimately cause the account to get suspended, to which they encourage the same player to open a new account and start paying from scratch all over again thus making them additional revenue. This practice is a revolving gaming ponzi scheme and should not be tolerated.

replies.body:
Hi. I'm not sure I fully understand where you're coming from with the whole 'questionable practices' thing. It says right here in the terms of use:
> We may terminate or suspend your account if we determine, in our sole discretion, that:
(a) you have violated any part of this Agreement;
(b) we have stopped offering the Riot Services in your region; or
(c) doing so would be in the best interests of our community, the Riot Services, or the rights of a third party.

And also here:
> If your account is terminated, you’ll no longer have access to it, including any of the associated data or content (e.g., champions, skins, Riot Points, etc.). You’ll not be entitled to any refunds and we’ll have no liability to you. We also reserve the right to terminate any other accounts you may have created (also without any refunds or liability to you).
You understand and agree that using the Riot Services comes with the risk that your account may be terminated or suspended and that, whenever you use the Riot Services, you’ll bear this risk in mind and always conduct yourself appropriately.

I doubt Riot is banning accounts for financial gain, it is more likely they are being banned for not complying with the Summoner's Code.
